byline.contributor: Jeffrey Moyo reported from Harare and Mutoko, Zimbabwe, and Norimitsu Onishi from Johannesburg.
byline.original: By JEFFREY MOYO and NORIMITSU ONISHI

abstract: Zimbabwe has been rapidly adopting cashless economy, with debit card machines proliferating in cities across country, and payment via text messaging on cellphones becoming increasingly common; driving trend is scarcity of American dollars, which country adopted in 2009 after abandoning its own currency.

headline.print_headline: With Little Choice, Zimbabweans Hurtle to a Cashless Economy
headline.main: A Cashless Economy in Zimbabwe? With Little Cash, There’s Little Choice

snippet: Debit card machines are proliferating in churches, supermarkets and nightclubs as anxious Zimbabweans hoard American dollars or take them out of the country....
lead_paragraph: Debit card machines are proliferating in churches, supermarkets and nightclubs as anxious Zimbabweans hoard American dollars or take them out of the country.
